meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or caused by amoebas.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the amebic infection in the pond water.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the amebic disease in the patient's stool sample.
meanings.sent3: The amebic amoebas threw a party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: Her amebic movements on the dance floor were fluid and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The amebic nature of the organism made it difficult to classify.

meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement.
meanings.sent1: The amebic blob slowly oozed across the microscope slide.
meanings.sent2: The jellyfish had an amebic appearance as it pulsated in the water.
meanings.sent3: The amebic cloud in the sky looked like a giant amoeba floating above.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved in an amebic manner, shifting and changing constantly.
meanings.sent5: The amebic shape of the sculpture captured the essence of fluidity and change.
